rules.name: Game of Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Conway's Game of Life. Birth/Survival rules (B/S counts) are configurable. Standard GoL is B3/S23. Edges are not used.

rules.name: Life with Color
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Standard GoL B/S node logic (computes binary eligibility 0/1). Edges not used. Node state stored is binary eligibility, but node color represents the number of active neighbors in the *previous* step (if coloring enabled).

rules.name: Lace Life with Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state uses GoL B/S counts, optionally modified by edge connectivity. Binary edges based on node activity/support. Node state/color can be binary, degree, or neighbor count.

rules.name: Colored Life with Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL B/S node logic (binary eligibility), optionally modified by edge connectivity. Binary edges based on node activity/support. Node state/color = degree (connection count in current step).

rules.name: Life with Edge Growth
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL B/S counts AND min edge strength sum required for birth/survival. Continuous edges (0-1) grow/decay based on node activity. Optional probabilistic edge changes based on neighbor degree.

rules.name: Life with Connectivity Weighting
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL B/S logic based on weighted neighbor count. Connected neighbors contribute more/less based on weights. Edges are binary (0/1). Optional probabilistic edge changes based on neighbor's incoming edge weight sum.

rules.name: Life with Dynamic Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL B/S counts combined with edge sum conditions (birth min, survival range). Continuous edges (0-1) change based on node activity, decay, randomness, and optional probabilistic/node-effect logic groups.

rules.name: Edge Feedback Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node birth depends on avg neighbor degree (prev step). Node survival depends on incoming edge weight sum (prev step). Continuous edges strengthen towards active neighbors.

rules.name: Edge Degree Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state = degree. Edges follow GoL-like rules based on combined degree of endpoints (prev step). Requires post-update step.

rules.name: Network Topology Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state = degree. Birth/Survival eligibility depends on neighbor counts, own degree, avg neighbor degree (prev step). Edges change based on relative degrees (prev step), favoring connections between nodes with different degrees and pruning overly similar/connected nodes. Aims for dynamic topological structures.

rules.name: Topological Rule
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Connects rules based on topological properties of local neighborhodd

rules.name: Modular Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL foundation with toggleable logic groups for node/edge interactions. Node state 0/1, Edge state 0-1. Uses 2nd-order neighbor active counts if Group 5 enabled.

rules.name: GoL Nodes GoL Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Nodes follow GoL B/S rules based on active neighbor counts. Edges follow GoL B/S rules based on the neighbor's degree from the previous step. Edges only form/survive if both nodes are predicted active.

rules.name: Configurable Continuous Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Continuous state (0-1) nodes/edges. State influenced by neighbor/edge averages and connection count. Edges based on avg node state or similarity. Tuned for more dynamic behavior.

rules.name: Bidirectional Feedback Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL foundation with toggleable logic groups for node/edge interactions based on neighbor counts, edge strength, degree, avg states, decay, randomness. Node state 0/1, Edge state 0-1.

rules.name: Configurable Life with Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL foundation with toggleable logic groups for node/edge interactions. Node state 0/1, Edge state 0-1. Uses 2nd-order neighbor active counts if Group 5 enabled.

rules.name: Life with Continuous Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Standard GoL B/S node logic, optionally modified by edge sum. Continuous edges (0-1) strengthen based on mutual neighbor support (prev step), decay, randomness. Optional node effects on edges.

rules.name: Weighted Edge Influence Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state (0/1) depends on sum of edge weights from active neighbors. Continuous edges (0-1) evolve based on either node similarity or average node activity, plus decay and randomness.

rules.name: Resource Competition Life
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Continuous node state (0-1) represents resources. Nodes consume/gain from neighbors. Birth/Survival depends on intake/self-state. Continuous edges (0-1) form competitively based on neighbor load/relative strength, and grow/decay.

rules.name: Life with Weighted Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL B/S counts AND min edge strength sum required for birth/survival. Edges have continuous states (0-1) and evolve based on avg node activity, inertia, and randomness.

rules.name: Multi-State Life with Edges
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Continuous state (0-1) nodes and edges. State influenced by neighbor/edge averages and connection count. Edges based on avg node state or similarity.

rules.name: Realm of Lace
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state = degree. Eligibility based on sum of neighbor degrees (prev step) within ranges. Edges exist only between mutually eligible nodes. Requires post-update step.

rules.name: Realm of Lace 2_Frogs
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state = degree. Eligibility based on sum of neighbor degrees (prev step) within ranges. Edges exist only between mutually eligible nodes. Requires post-update step.

rules.name: 2D CA Master Rule
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: General 2D CA (Moore neighborhood) using configurable B/S counts. State rule table can override.

rules.name: Master Configurable Rule
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Highly configurable rule combining multiple optional logic blocks for node (0/1) and edge (0-1) updates. Node state via AND logic across enabled groups (GoL, Edge Sum, Prev Degree, Avg Edge, Current Degree). Edge state via priority override (Node Effects > Neigh Degree > Similarity > Node Activity) plus Decay/Randomness.

rules.name: Angular Edge Rule
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state = degree. Node eligibility based on angular patterns of its edges (prev step). Edges (0/1) change based on endpoint degrees (prev step). Requires post-update step.

rules.name: Lace Life with Edges_Mazes
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state uses GoL B/S counts, optionally modified by edge connectivity. Binary edges based on node activity/support. Node state/color can be binary, degree, or neighbor count.

rules.name: Lace Life with Edges_Mazes_2
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Node state uses GoL B/S counts, optionally modified by edge connectivity. Binary edges based on node activity/support. Node state/color can be binary, degree, or neighbor count.

rules.name: Life with Continuous Edges_More Colors
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Standard GoL B/S node logic, optionally modified by edge sum. Continuous edges (0-1) strengthen based on mutual neighbor support (prev step), decay, randomness. Optional node effects on edges.

rules.name: Life with Dynamic Edges_Strands
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: GoL B/S counts combined with edge sum conditions (birth min, survival range). Continuous edges (0-1) change based on node activity, decay, randomness, and optional probabilistic/node-effect logic groups.

rules.description: Unified ROL variant. Node state=degree. Eligibility uses configurable metrics (Degree, Clustering, Betweenness, Active Neigh Count) and aggregation (Sum, Average) independently for birth/survival. Optional perturbations.

rules.description: Unified ROL variant. Node state=degree. Eligibility uses configurable metrics (Degree, Clustering, Betweenness, Active Neigh Count) and aggregation (Sum, Average) independently for birth/survival. Optional perturbations.
rules.notes: Uses BETWEENNESS/SUM for eligibility. Example adjusted ranges: Birth=[(1.3, 3.6)], Survival=[(0.9, 2.6)]. Fine-tune these!

rules.notes: Uses BETWEENNESS/SUM for eligibility. Example adjusted ranges: Birth=[(1.1, 3.2)], Survival=[(0.7, 2.2)]. Fine-tune these!

rules.author: Nova Spivack

rules.notes: Uses CLUSTERING/SUM for eligibility. Example adjusted ranges: Birth=[(0.32, 0.72)], Survival=[(0.22, 0.62)]. Fine-tune these!

rules.name: ROL-U Approximating GoL
rules.author: GoL Approximation
rules.description: Approximation of Conway's Game of Life using RealmOfLaceUnified. Uses ACTIVE_NEIGHBOR_COUNT (previous step eligibility proxy sum) for eligibility and final degree check for life/death. Expect deviations due to time delay and state differences.
rules.notes: This is an approximation. Node state is degree, not binary. Eligibility uses previous step's neighbor eligibility proxy count, not current live neighbors.

rules.name: ROL-U Dynamic Symmetry Promoter
rules.author: AI Design
rules.description: ROL-U rule designed to promote dynamic symmetrical patterns. Uses SYMMETRY_DEGREE (low scores = high symmetry) for eligibility. Final life/death based on degree.
rules.notes: Birth/Survival require low SYMMETRY_DEGREE scores (high symmetry) from the previous step. Final life requires degree 2-5. Tune symmetry ranges and final life/death degrees for different behaviors.

rules.name: ROL-U Test - Symmetry State
rules.author: Test Generator
rules.description: ROL-U test rule using SYMMETRY_STATE for eligibility. Very permissive life/death criteria to prevent early death. State = Degree.
rules.notes: Eligibility based on state difference between opposing neighbors (previous step). Range set wide for testing.

rules.name: ROL-U Test - Symmetry Degree
rules.author: Test Generator
rules.description: ROL-U test rule using SYMMETRY_DEGREE for eligibility. Very permissive life/death criteria to prevent early death. State = Degree.
rules.notes: Eligibility based on degree difference between opposing neighbors (previous step). Range set wide for testing.

rules.name: ROL-U Test - Neighbor Degree Variance
rules.author: Test Generator
rules.description: ROL-U test rule using NEIGHBOR_DEGREE_VARIANCE for eligibility. Very permissive life/death criteria to prevent early death. State = Degree.
rules.notes: Eligibility based on variance of neighbor degrees (previous step). Range set wide for testing.

rules.name: ROL-U Test - Neighbor Degree StdDev
rules.author: Test Generator
rules.description: ROL-U test rule using NEIGHBOR_DEGREE_STDDEV for eligibility. Very permissive life/death criteria to prevent early death. State = Degree.
rules.notes: Eligibility based on standard deviation of neighbor degrees (previous step). Range set wide for testing.

rules.description: Unified ROL variant. Node state=degree. Eligibility uses configurable metrics (Degree, Clustering, Betweenness, Active Neigh Count) and aggregation (Sum, Average) independently for birth/survival. Optional perturbations.
rules.notes: Uses BETWEENNESS/SUM for eligibility. Example adjusted ranges: Birth=[(1.3, 3.6)], Survival=[(0.9, 2.6)]. Fine-tune these!

rules.name: Configurable Continuous Life_Stars
rules.author: Nova Spivack
rules.description: Continuous state (0-1) nodes/edges. State influenced by neighbor/edge averages and connection count. Edges based on avg node state or similarity. Tuned for more dynamic behavior.
